caption.p: dsRNA based drugs: modern trends of pharmaceutical developments

tr.td: Mixture of dsRNA and single stranded RNA from Saccharomyces cerevisiae
Mixture of dsRNA and single stranded RNA from Saccharomyces cerevisiae, stabilized with polyvinylpyrrolidone
Arbovirus and rhabdovirus infections, herpetic diseases
Double-stranded complex polyriboadenylic and polyribouridylic acids
Viral eye diseases (adenovirus and herpetic infections), influenza and SARS
Double-stranded complex polyriboadenylic and polyribouridylic acids
Hepatitis B and C (as a part of IFN-α based complex therapy), breast cancer
Double-stranded complex of polyriboguanylic and polyribocytidylic acids
Viral infections (caused by viruses of encephalomyocarditis, tick-borne encephalitis, vesicular stomatitis)
Double-stranded complex of polyriboguanylic and polyribocytidylic acids (100 bp)
To increase efficiency of vaccination (activation of dendritic cells, T-cell proliferation)
Double-stranded complex of polyriboinosinic and polyribocytidylic acids
University of Alabama at Birmingham, Hemispherx Biopharma, Inc. (USA); Medical University of South Carolina, Gibbs Cancer Center and Research Institute, Eli Lilly and Company (USA), etc.

Institute of Pharmaceutical Sciences, Institute of Molecular Biology and Biophysics (Switzerland); Nanjing Agricultural University (China); Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai (USA); Yonsei University (South Korea); The University of Tokyo (Japan), etc.
For antitumor therapy of malignant neoplasms of different localization, enhancement of immunogenicity of antitumor vaccines
Double-stranded complex of polyriboinosinic and polyribocytidylic acids (100–400 bp)

td.p: Kyowa Hakko Bio Co., Ltd., Hofu (Japan);

tr.td: For prophylaxis and treatment of infectious and oncological diseases
Double-stranded complex of polyriboinosinic and polyribocytidylic acids modified by polymers and/or encapsulated into particles
Research laboratories in Germany, China, Italy, the Netherlands, Canada, Belgium, Australia, USA
Oncological diseases of various localization (glioblastoma, adenocarcinoma, breast cancer, melanoma)
Double-stranded complex of polyriboinosinic and polyribocytidylic acids with non-covalent adduct of poly-L-lysine and carboxymethylcellulose
Oncological diseases of various localization, including inoperable cancer cases, viral infections, increased immunogenicity of vaccines
Double-stranded complexes of homopolyribonucleotide and polyribonucleotide copolymer
Double-stranded complex of polyriboinosinic acid and copolymer of polyribocytidylic and uridylic acids (at a ratio 12 : 1)
Clinical trials. Approved for medical application (Argentina)

td.p: Complex therapy of syndromes of chronic fatigue and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS), breast cancer, liver, prostate, ovarian cancer, colorectal cancer, mesothelioma
Severe cases of myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome

tr.td: Double-stranded complex of polyriboinosinic acid and copolymer of polyribocytidylic and uridylic acids (at a ratio 30 : 1)
For the prevention and treatment of infectious and oncological diseases
Double-stranded complex of polyribocytidylic acid and copolymer of polyguanylic and polyriboinosinic acids (100 bp)
For the prevention and treatment of infectious and oncological diseases
